Today, the State Education Department released guidance for schools to reopen in the fall. This follows a framework of guidance that the Board of Regents presented on Monday. The information is available on the State Education Department’s website, http://www.nysed.gov/.

Wynantskill UFSD will review the guidance as we work together with faculty, staff and families to create a plan for reopening in the fall. The plan will incorporate both in-school and remote learning to account for our capacity to follow the Department of Health guidelines and COVID-19 infection rates at any given time. As always, the health and safety of your children is our top priority and our plan will always be based on that priority. We will certainly keep our community updated as that work progresses during the next two weeks.

School districts will have to submit reopening plans to the State by July 31, with Governor Cuomo announcing a decision on the reopening of schools during the week of August 1.

The Board of Education would like to update the community about its superintendent search process.

At tonight's meeting, the Board agreed to use Questar III BOCES to assist the district's search with the goal of having a superintendent appointed as close to the opening of the 2020-21 school year as possible.

The district will use an online community survey to help the Board build criteria for the next superintendent and questions for the Board to ask during interviews.

Principal Dr. Mary Yodis was appointed interim superintendent effective July 1 to lead the district during the search.

The Board will continue to keep our community updated about the search process as it proceeds. Thank you.

Wynantskill UFSD would like to let families know that the school is planning to have a “drive-through” process for families to pick up belongings left at school Monday, June 15 and Tuesday, June 16 from 8:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m.

To help ensure the health and safety of families and school staff, our custodial staff will bag belongings, which families can pick up in the bus loop near the gym. We will bring items out to families, including personal items, any medications, musical instruments, art projects and other student items.

Families will also be able to drop off any laptop computers, textbooks, library books, musical instruments or other items that need to be returned to the school. Staff will be available to pick up items at families’ vehicles. We ask everyone to practice social distancing and wear masks if you exit your vehicle.

Families with last names from A-K will pick up on Monday, June 15. Families with last names from L-Z will pick up on Tuesday, June 16. If these dates do not work, please call the Main Office at 518-283-4600 ext. 10. Thank you.

Wynantskill UFSD would like to update our community about the school budget vote. Governor Cuomo recently announced school budget votes and Board of Education elections will take place Tuesday, June 9. Voting will take place only through absentee ballot. Every eligible voter will receive an absentee ballot and a postage paid return envelope in the mail.

More information is available on our website. We will share information about the 2020-21 school budget as soon as we know more. The Board of Education is waiting until May 21 to adopt a budget in order to gather more information about state aid. Governor Cuomo is expected to announce in the next week or so whether funding for education will be cut further due to the state budget deficit. Thank you.
